chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas W Bellair was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas W Bellair in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states agreement.  Restitution paid ahead of today's hearing.  Atty Steinman agrees and NC pleas entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty.  Atty Steinman makes statement on behalf of DE.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  amended to Misd. OMVWOC - 943.23(3m) - NC
Ct 2:  amended to Misd. Eluding - 346.04(2t) - NC
Probation for 12 months on each count concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Ct 1 only: 5 day jail w/huber privileges consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 2/10/2015 at 6:00 pm unless agent directs otherwise
$443.00 x 2 to be paid during term of probation per agent
AODA/Treatment per agent
Seek/maintain full-time employment/education
Any other counseling/treatment per agent
DE to report to P&P today by 3:30 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas W Bellair in court with attorney Thomas L. Steinman.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request 3 week reset due to defendant needing to come up with money for restitution purposes at plea.  Court approves.  Matter to be reduced to misdemeanor.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on November 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Return date on October 3, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas W Bellair appeared by video means with Attorney Steinman. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does qualify and Attorney Steinman gives new address.  State request $500 cash bond w/ other conditions.  Attorney Steinman notes defendant is employed.  No warrants or criminal history.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived. $250.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with Great Wolf Lodge.  Not to oper MV w/out valid DL, absolute sobriety and must submit chemical testing by law enforcement.  No taverns or liquor stores.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 08:45 am.  Return date scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
